Recall Daihatsu
Perbaikan 'Stang Seher' Gran Max dan Luxio Butuh Waktu 14 Jam
01 Nov 2019, 22:58 by , https://www.facebook.com/CNNIndonesia


Ilustrasi proses perbaikan stang seher Daihatsu Gran Max dan Luxio. (Foto: CNN Indonesia/Rayhand Purnama Karim JP)

Jakarta, CNN Indonesia -- Biaya perbaikan connecting road atau 'stang seher' Daihatsu Gran Max 1.5L dan Luxio ditaksir mencapai Rp221,49 miliar. Angka tersebut berdasarkan biaya perbaikan satu unit mobil sekitar Rp6 juta sudah termasuk ongkos montir dan komponen. Sedangkan mobil yang terdata harus mengikuti kampanye perbaikan atau recall mencapai 36.915 unit.Daihatsu mengumumkan kampanye perbaikan untuk Gran Max 1.5L dan Luxio produksi Maret 2018 sampai April 2019."Itu kan turun mesin dan ongkos kerjanya mahal, jadi ya sekitar Rp6 juta," kata Direktur Marketing Astra Daihatsu Motor (ADM) Amelia Tjandra di Sunter, Jakarta Utara, Jumat (1/11).Technical Services Division Head ADM Anjar Rosjadi mengatakan semua biaya perbaikan sepenuhnya akan ditanggung Daihatsu, meski 'kesalahan' ada pada pemasok komponen.Recall kali ini dikarenakan cacat produksi pada 'stang seher' yang menghubungkan piston dengan crank shaft. Komponen ini disebut riskan patah."Jadi ini proses pembuatan part di supplier ADM. Tapi ini jadi tanggungjawabnya ADM," ungkap Anjar.Menurut Anjar pihak Daihatsu juga tidak mengganti supplier dan material komponen itu. Hanya saja pihaknya akan memastikan bila pembuatan komponen sesuai standar yang sudah ditetapkan oleh Daihatsu."Kemudian ini saya jelaskan hanya perubahan proses (pembuatan part). Jadi secara material tidak ada masalah," ucap Anjar.Lebih lanjut Amelia, pihaknya tidak menargetkan kapan recall untuk mobil-mobil yang teridentifikasi selesai seluruhnya diperbaiki. Kata Amelia proses perbaikan menghabiskan waktu14 jam karena kategorinya 'turun mesin'."Terus ini juga ada yang komersial. Jadi ya suka-suka mereka. Kalau mereka sibuk ya belum daftar (masuk bengkel untuk perbaikan)," tutup Amelia. (ryh/mik)

Daihatsu recall
Repairing 'Handlebar Seher' Gran Max and Luxio Takes 14 Hours
01 Nov 2019, 22:58 by, https://www.facebook.com/CNNIndonesia


Illustration of the Daihatsu Gran Max and Luxio handlebar repair process. (Photo: CNN Indonesia / Rayhand Purnama Karim JP)

Jakarta, CNN Indonesia - The cost of repairing the connecting road or 'handlebar piston' of Daihatsu Gran Max 1.5L and Luxio is estimated to reach Rp.221.49 billion. This figure is based on the cost of repairing one unit of car around Rp. 6 million including the cost of the mechanic and components. While the recorded cars must follow the repair or recall campaign reaching 36,915 units. Daihatsu announced a repair campaign for the Gran Max 1.5L and Luxio production from March 2018 to April 2019. "That is down the engine and the cost of work is expensive, so yes around Rp6 million," said Marketing Director of Astra Daihatsu Motor (ADM) Amelia Tjandra in Sunter, North Jakarta, Friday (1/11). ADM Technical Services Division Head Anjar Rosjadi said that all repair costs will be fully borne by Daihatsu, even though 'mistakes' are with the component suppliers. This is due to a production defect in the 'piston handlebar' which connects the piston to the crank shaft. This component is called risk broken. "So this is the process of making parts at ADM suppliers. But this is ADM's responsibility," said Anjar. According to Anjar, Daihatsu also did not replace the component suppliers and material. It's just that he will make sure when making components according to standards set by Daihatsu. "Then I will explain only the change in the process (making parts). So materially there are no problems," said Anjar. Furthermore Amelia, it does not target when the recall to recall the identified cars have been completely repaired. Amelia said the repair process took 14 hours because the category was 'dismissed'. "Then there are also commercial ones. So, I like them. If they are busy, they have not registered (entered a repair shop)," closed Amelia. (ryh / mic)
